models.inboxItems: Individual items in the inbox queue that need human review or decision. Each item represents something waiting for your attention - agent-generated drafts, approval requests, flagged issues, or mentions in discussions.
models.teamMembers: Team members (human or AI agent) that can be assigned to parties, projects, work orders, or tasks. Represents workforce capacity and assignment.
models.projects: A collection of work being done for a party, containing multiple work orders. Represents the top-level container for related work.
models.workOrders: A specific unit of work within a project that needs to be completed. Represents a trackable, structured piece of work with clear scope and deliverables.

relationships: Each Inbox Item is created by a Team Member (human or AI agent)
Inbox Items link to related Work Orders or Projects for context
Agent-generated Inbox Items include AI confidence scores
Inbox Items are categorized by type: agent_draft, approval, flag, or mention

inboxItems.title: Task Breakdown: Homepage Redesign Implementation
inboxItems.contentPreview: I've broken down the homepage redesign into 8 actionable tasks with estimated hours and dependencies...
inboxItems.fullContent:
# Task Breakdown: Homepage Redesign Implementation

Based on the work order requirements, here's the detailed task breakdown:

## Tasks
1. **Create wireframes** (4h) - Design low-fidelity layouts
2. **Design mockups** (8h) - High-fidelity designs in Figma
3. **Implement header** (6h) - Responsive navigation component
4. **Implement hero section** (4h) - Landing hero with CTA
5. **Implement features grid** (5h) - Feature showcase section
6. **Implement testimonials** (3h) - Customer testimonial carousel
7. **Implement footer** (2h) - Footer with links and social
8. **QA and polish** (4h) - Cross-browser testing and refinement

**Total estimate:** 36 hours
**Dependencies:** Tasks 1-2 must complete before 3-8
**Notes:** All components should be mobile-first and use the design system tokens.

inboxItems.title: Risk: Missing Acceptance Criteria
inboxItems.contentPreview: Work order 'Marketing Automation Setup' has no acceptance criteria defined. This could lead to scope creep...
inboxItems.fullContent:
# Risk Identified: Missing Acceptance Criteria

**Work Order:** Marketing Automation Setup
**Severity:** Medium
**Identified by:** QA Agent

## Issue
This work order was started without clearly defined acceptance criteria. The team has completed 60% of the estimated work, but there's no clear definition of "done."

## Risks
- Scope creep and endless revisions
- Client dissatisfaction due to misaligned expectations
- Unable to determine when work is complete
- QA Agent cannot validate deliverables

## Recommendation
Pause work and schedule a requirements clarification call with the client. Document acceptance criteria before proceeding further.

## Affected Items
- Work Order: wo-003
- Assigned to: Sarah Chen
- Client: TechStart Inc

@alex Can you approve the additional 8 hours for the reporting dashboard?

Options:

What do you think?

inboxItems.title: SOP Suggestion: Website Launch Checklist
inboxItems.contentPreview: Based on our recent website projects, I've created a reusable launch checklist to ensure nothing gets missed...
inboxItems.fullContent:
# Standard Operating Procedure: Website Launch Checklist

**Created by:** QA Agent
**Purpose:** Ensure consistent, thorough website launches with zero missed steps

## Pre-Launch (1 week before)
- [ ] All content approved by client
- [ ] SSL certificate installed and verified
- [ ] Backup of old site created
- [ ] DNS records documented
- [ ] Analytics and tracking codes installed
- [ ] Forms tested (contact, newsletter, etc.)
- [ ] Cross-browser testing complete (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- [ ] Mobile responsiveness verified
- [ ] Page speed optimization complete
- [ ] SEO meta tags verified

## Launch Day
- [ ] Deploy to production at agreed time
- [ ] Update DNS records
- [ ] Verify all pages load correctly
- [ ] Test all forms in production
- [ ] Verify analytics tracking
- [ ] Update sitemap.xml
- [ ] Submit to Google Search Console

## Post-Launch (first 48h)
- [ ] Monitor error logs
- [ ] Check analytics data
- [ ] Respond to any client feedback
- [ ] Create post-launch report

**Recommendation:** Apply this SOP to all website launch work orders going forward.

inboxItems.title: Change Request: Add Mobile App to Scope
inboxItems.contentPreview: Client has requested adding a companion mobile app to the project. This requires budget and timeline adjustment...
inboxItems.fullContent:
# Change Request

**Project:** BuildRight Reporting
**Requested by:** Client (BuildRight team)
**Change type:** Scope expansion

## Request Details
Client wants to add a mobile app (iOS and Android) that mirrors the web dashboard functionality. They want users to check reports on the go.

## Impact Assessment

### Additional Work
- Mobile app design (16h)
- iOS development (40h)
- Android development (40h)
- API modifications (12h)
- Testing & QA (16h)
- App store submission (8h)

**Total additional hours:** 132h
**Additional cost:** ~$13,200
**Timeline impact:** +4 weeks

## Recommendation
This is a significant scope increase. I recommend:
1. Treating this as a separate Phase 2 project
2. Completing the web dashboard first (original scope)
3. Gathering detailed mobile requirements before starting
4. Creating a separate proposal with clear deliverables

**Action needed:** Approve/reject this approach and authorize me to communicate with the client.

inboxItems.title: Low Confidence: Task Breakdown Accuracy
inboxItems.contentPreview: I've created a task breakdown for the e-commerce integration, but my confidence is low due to limited context...
inboxItems.fullContent:
# Low Confidence Warning

**Work Order:** E-commerce Integration
**Task:** Task breakdown
**Created by:** PM Copilot
**Confidence level:** Low

## Why Low Confidence?

I've created a task breakdown based on the work order description, but I'm missing key information:

1. **Unknown integration platform** - Work order doesn't specify which e-commerce system (Shopify, WooCommerce, custom?)
2. **Unclear requirements** - No acceptance criteria defined
3. **Missing technical constraints** - No info about existing systems or APIs
4. **Limited historical data** - No similar projects in history to reference

## What I Created (with caveats)

I've made a generic task breakdown with placeholder estimates, but it should NOT be used without clarification:

- Integration setup (8-16h) *highly variable*
- Product sync (4-12h) *depends on catalog size*
- Order processing (6-10h) *depends on complexity*
- Testing (4-8h) *minimum estimate*

## Recommendation
Schedule a requirements gathering call with the client to clarify:
- Which platform they're using
- Data volume and complexity
- Integration points needed
- Performance requirements

Once we have this info, I can provide a high-confidence breakdown.
